mdRecord.dcterms:description: "By 1836, Oberlin villagers decided to have a school built just for their children. They also believed it would be better for the school to become part of the state's common, or public, school system rather than part of Oberlin College. For $215, a one room schoolhouse built on the north east corner of Main and Lorain streets -- a little north of where First Church now stands. This small school measured 20 x 20 feet and had only one room. For many years it was the only school for children in Oberlin." -- http://www.oberlin.edu/external/EOG/OYTT/ch5.html [work]
